newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico Contal says raised soft drink prices.
newsitem.headline: Mexico Contal says raised soft drink prices.

text.p: Mexican Coca-Cola bottler Grupo Continental (Contal) raised soft drink prices between 10.4 and 11.2 percent from March, a company executive said on Tuesday.
The increase will affect central states of Durango, Zacatecas, San Luis Potosi, Aguascalientes and Coahuila, Contal chief financial officer Miguel Angel Rabago told Reuters.
Jalisco was the only state the company serves where prices were not raised, he said, as marketing studies are still being conducted in the region.
The soft drink price increase follows a recent spike in domestic sugar prices.
Rabago said the April price hike also aims to take advantage of higher seasonal soft drink consumption in the second and third quarters.
Contal has 16 bottling plants and distributes in six states, for the largest territory of any Coca-Cola bottler in Mexico.
